messages.message:
Thanks Varun - I understand. The feedback is primarily that the user behaviour in Converse is often to prototype to get the answers needed, and then to replicate in Build to set up a workflow.

Because the user is totally unaware of the fact we have chosen not to include Advanced they then get to a place where their solution won’t work as they had expected and it’s a bad user experience
Makes sense, Tom. We were discussing this yesterday. We need to explain Build better to our users and communicate clearly on the limitations, especially if something works in one app vs the rest.
